subject: Communication
title: Customer Testimonials as Narrative
description: A micro-lesson that makes Customer Testimonials as Narrative usable.

hook.text: A company says 'We're great.' You shrug. A customer says 'They changed my life.' You lean in.

buildup.text: Testimonials work as stories because they have a character (the customer), a problem, and a transformation.

discovery.text: The best testimonials follow narrative structure: 'Before, I struggled with X. Then I found Y. Now, Z.'

twist.text: Generic praise ('Great product!') has almost no persuasive power. Specific transformation stories do.

climax.text: Amazon reviews became the world's largest storytelling platform â€” millions of micro-narratives driving purchases.

punchline.text: The best salesperson isn't you. It's your customer's story.

quiz.question: What makes a customer testimonial most persuasive?
